item.title: Creating a Hugo Blog with your own layout
item.description: Creating a Hugo Blog with your own layout A Hugo blog is a great way to learn more about HTML and CSS before jumping into a CSS framework. You can even host the site for free using GitHub pages and come out of it with a blog/site that you can be proud of. This is what I wanted to do when I created my blog. However, after reading some guides and watching some videos, I had no idea where to start.

item.title: Markdown Cheatsheet
item.description: Markdown Cheatsheet Headings The following HTML elements <h1>-<h6> elements represent six levels of section headings. <h1> is the highest section level while <h6 is the lowest. H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with asterisks or underscores. Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores. Strikethrough uses two tildes. Scratch this. Lists First ordered list item. Second ordered list item. Unordered sub-list.
